abstract: In an effort to focus on higher-growth wireless and Internet offerings, Verizon Communications will spin off $2.72 billion in landline businesses in Maine, New Hampshire and Vermont, merging them with FairPoint Communications. Verizon shareholders will own 60 percent of the new company, which will have 1.6 million local lines, 234,000 high-speed Internet subscribers and 600,000 customers. Verizon will also shed $1.7 billion in debt in the spinoff.
